pr_title: Issue #1043 Added IntervalBiFunction to calculate wait duration based on result/exception

timeline.message: Issue #1043 Added IntervalBiFunction to calculate wait duration from result or exception

timeline.bodyText:
By convention, Either's Left represents a failure case and the Right represents a success.
T and Throwable must be switched.
timeline.author: RobWin
timeline.diffHunk:

+package io.github.resilience4j.core;
+
+import io.vavr.control.Either;
+
+import java.util.function.BiFunction;
+
+/**
+ * An IntervalBiFunction which can be used to calculate the wait interval. The input parameters of the bi
+ * function is the number of attempts (attempt) and either result or exception, the output parameter is the wait interval in
+ * milliseconds. The attempt parameter starts at 1 and increases with every further attempt.
+ */
+@FunctionalInterface
+public interface IntervalBiFunction<T> extends BiFunction<Integer, Either<T, Throwable>, Long> {

replies.bodyText:
Hmm, I tried this and found an interesting use case, the following code will throw IllegalStateException
RetryConfig baseConfig = RetryConfig.ofDefaults();
RetryConfig retryConfig = RetryConfig.from(baseConfig)
            .intervalFunction(IntervalFunction.of(100L))
            .build();
Because baseConfig.intervalBiFunction = bi function of interval defaults and since config.intervalBiFunction is the only used by Retry I thought that only this value should be copied from base config on RetryConfig.from(baseConfig), therefore retryConfig.intervalBiFunction = baseConfig.intervalBiFunction
I'm kind of stuck with this, any idea?

I was trying to avoid that kind of implementation.
What I've done is this: whenever intervalFunction is set then when creating a new builder with RetryConfig.from only intervalFunction is copied from base config. Because intervalBiFunction is always present and when build is invoked will be created from intervalFunction.
See the implementation :)
